text: What is the fastest / easiest way to count large number of files in a directory (in Linux)?
I had some directory, with large number of files.
Every time I tried to access the list of files within it, I was not able to do that or there was significant delay.
I was trying to use ls command within comman-line on Linux and web interface from my hosting provider did not help also.
The problem is, that when I just do ls, it takes significant ammount of time to even start displaying something.
Thus, ls | wc -l would not help also.
After some research I came up with this code (in this example it counts number of new emails on some server):

code: print sum([len(files) for (root, dirs, files) in walk('/home/myname/Maildir/new')])

text: The above code is written in Python.
I used Python's command-line tool and it worked pretty fast (returned result instantly).
I am interested in the answer to the following question: is it possible to count files in a directory (without subdirectories) faster?
What is the fastest way to do that?
